title: Pueblo Nuevo (danzón)
text:
"Juventud del Pueblo Nuevo", or simply "Pueblo Nuevo", is a <a href="danz%C3%B3n">danzón</a> composed by Cuban bassist Israel López "<a href="Cachao">Cachao</a>". It is one of his many compositions dedicated to a Cuban venue where he frequently played as part of the <a href="Charanga%20%28Cuba%29">charanga</a> <a href="Arca%C3%B1o%20y%20sus%20Maravillas">Arcaño y sus Maravillas</a>. It has become a <a href="standard%20%28music%29">standard</a> of the genre, being regularly performed by danzón orchestras over the years.
It was first recorded in 1946 by Belisario López's orchestra for <a href="RCA%20Victor">RCA Victor</a>. The Maravillas recorded it in their eponymous 1980 reunion album, released by <a href="Areito%20%28record%20label%29">Areito</a>. It was recorded by <a href="Frank%20Emilio%20Flynn">Frank Emilio Flynn</a> for his 1999 album "Ancestral Reflections" and by <a href="Buena%20Vista%20Social%20Club">Buena Vista Social Club</a> for their <a href="Buena%20Vista%20Social%20Club%20%28album%29">eponymous album</a> (although misattributed to <a href="Rub%C3%A9n%20Gonz%C3%A1lez%20%28pianist%29">Rubén González</a> in the liner notes).
